meanings.definition: To wind or coil in a reverse direction.
meanings.sent1: She tried backwinding the thread to undo the knot.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic backwinding the spring to fix the clock.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally backwound the yarn, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements backwound gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to backwind through the valley, flowing backward.

meanings.definition: The act of reversing the direction of winding.
meanings.sent1: The sudden backwinding of the rope surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The backwinding of the hose caused a delay in the process.
meanings.sent3: The backwinding of the story made it even more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The backwinding of time in the movie was mind-bending.
meanings.sent5: The backwinding of the road led them to an unexpected destination.

meanings.definition: A technique used in fishing to prevent line tangles.
meanings.sent1: The angler demonstrated the backwinding method to the beginners.
meanings.sent2: Using backwinding helped the fisherman avoid snags in the line.
meanings.sent3: The fish seemed amused by the backwinding trick.
meanings.sent4: The backwinding technique was like a magic spell for untangling.
meanings.sent5: The backwinding skill of the fisherman impressed his friends.

meanings.definition: A method of rewinding a film reel in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent1: The director preferred the backwinding process for special effects.
meanings.sent2: The editor used backwinding to create a unique visual effect.
meanings.sent3: The backwinding of the film reel made the movie more intriguing.
meanings.sent4: The backwinding of the footage added a surreal touch to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The backwinding technique gave the film a mesmerizing quality.
